Aiman Ashraf wrote:
>
>
> >>First, servers are allowed to store lots of things.
> In the database? I assume that would work and is better than storing 
> stuff on server (from a scalability point of view), but I'm not so 
> sure if that doesn't violate the 'stateless server' constraint.

The stateless constraint refers to client-server interaction

Cheers,
Mike
